questions.description: Units of the magnetic flux density or magnetic induction is :
The magnetic flux related to a coil rotating in a uniform magnetic field will be max, when the angle between plane of coil and magnetic field is :
According to Faraday's Laws of electro magnetic induction :

options.description: The direction of the induced current is such that it oppose itself
The induced emf in the coil is proportional to the rate of change of magnetic flux associated with it
The direction of induced emf is such that it opposes itself

questions.description: The ratio of magnetic flux and the resistance has the same units as :

A magnet if carried towards a coil :
(i) fast
(ii) slowly
The induced emf will be :

options.description: depends on the radius of coil

questions.description:
Assertion : The direction of induced emf is always such as to oppose the change that cause it.
Reason : Conservation of energy applies to know the direction of induced emf.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

questions.description: A circular conducting loop is placed in transverse magnetic field. If that loop is suddenly deformed in square. What is the direction of induced current :

Figures shows planar loops of different shapes out of or into a magnetic field which is directed normal to the plane of the loop away from reader. What is direction of induced current in loop A and B :

Assertion : When a conducting loop is kept stationary in a non-uniform magnetic field an emf is not induced.
Reason : As per Faraday's law whenever flux changs an emf is induced.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

questions.description: The north pole of long horziontal bar magnet is carried towards a vertical conducting plane. The direction of induced current in the conducting plane will be :
The Lenz's law is based on the conservation of a physical quantity. The physical quantity is :
Under which of the following conditions the emf may induce in the coil :

options.description: In changing the magnetic field near a coil
A magnet is brought near to the coil
On rotating a coil in a magnetic field

questions.description: Magnetic field through a coil is changed with respect to time then emf induced in it then select the incorrect regarding induced emf in coil -

options.description: Coil may be made up with wood
Coil may be connected with an open circuit
Coil must be of conducting nature
Induced emf does not depends upon resistance of the coil

questions.description: As shown in the figure a magnet is brought towards a coil suddenly. Due to which the induced EMF, induced current and the induced charge are E, I and Q respectively. If the speed of magnet is doubled then which of these statement is incorrect :
When a conducting ring is moving in a magnetic field, then induced charge depends on :

options.description: Rate of change in the magnetic flux
On the total change in magnetic flux
Only on the final magnetic flux

questions.description: A magnetic NS is suspended from a spring and while it oscillates the magnet moves in and out the coil C. If the coil is now connected to a galvanometer G as shown in the figure, then as the magnet oscillates, G shows :

options.description: deflection to the left and right with constant amplitude
deflection to the left and right but amplitude steadily decreases

questions.description: To determine the direction of induced current in a circuit of coil, which of the following laws is used :

Consider the following statements : 
(A) An emf can be induced by rotating a conducting loop in a uniform magnetic field
(B) An induced emf can be produced in a rectangular loop moving with uniform speed in a non homogeneous magnetic field
(C) An emf can be induced in a circular loop by changing electric flux through it very rapidly, Then

options.description: All A, B and C are correct
Both A and B are correct, C is wrong
Only A is correct, both B and C are wrong
All A, B and C are wrong

questions.description:
Statement-I : When the magnetic flux through a loop is maximum, induced emf is maximum.
Statement-II : When the magnetic flux through a loop is minimum, induced emf is minimum.

options.description: Statement-I is correct and statement-II is incorrect.
Statement-I is incorrect and statement-II is correct.

questions.description: When a current carrying coil is placed inside the magnetic field then it may have :

Which statement is correct from following :
(a) Inductor store energy in the form of magnetic field
(b) Capacitor store energy in the form of electric field
(c) Inductor store energy in the form of electric and magnetic field both
(d) Capacitor store energy in the form of electric and magnetic field both

Statement-I : When two coils are wound on each other the mutual inductance between the coils is maximum.
Statement-II : Mutual induction is independent of orientation of coil.

options.description: Statement-I is correct and statement-II is incorrect.
Statement-I is incorrect and statement-II is correct.

questions.description: The dimensions of  L/R, the ratio of inductance to resistance is the same as :
If  the key K is open suddenly then the bulb :

options.description: Glow with max. intensity for a moment & then gets off.

questions.description: Slots are cut in metallic strip as shown in the figure. It is suspended from point P. If the strip is made to oscillate in a magnetic field normal to the plane of paper, then :

options.description: the motion of the strip will slowly be opposed
the motion of the strip will be rapidly opposed

options.description: they will not experience any force

questions.description:
Statement-I : In LR circuit when switch is closed current at time t = 0 is zero.
Statement-II : Inductor oppose the change of flux.

options.description: Statement-I is correct and statement-II is incorrect.
Statement-I is incorrect and statement-II is correct.
